item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:45 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.
Status and possible action on pending legislation. (JA/SC-SF)
Current status of state and federal efforts to reduce plastic marine debris.
Consideration and adoption of Commission resolution to eliminate the Commission's use of single-use plastics at Commission meetings.

(DG-V)

subitem_title: City of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-SBC-21-0052-1 (Accessory Dwelling Unit) Certification Review

subitem_title: Application No. 4-21-0103 (City of Santa Barbara Waterfront Department)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Santa Barbara Waterfront Dept. to implement a comprehensive sediment management program involving dredging and beach nourishment conducted on as-needed basis with maximum of 500,000 cu. yds. of material to be dredged annually, beach grooming, install lifeguard towers, construct four seasonal sand berms, maintenance of storm drain outlets, and two fireworks displays at harbor and waterfront area, including Leadbetter Beach, West Beach, and East Beach, Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (IQ-V)

Application of Goleta Gardens LLC for Development Agreement between Goleta Gardens LLC and the City of Goleta to require the City to use the development standards of the City’s former zoning ordinance for the review of a development project at 907 South Kellogg Avenue, Goleta, Santa Barbara County. ADU at 245 30th Place and 247 29th Street, Hermosa Beach, Los Angeles County. (VL-LB)

(SA-LB)

item_title: Items Th13a and Th13b below will share a single, combined public hearing.

subitem_title: Notice of Impending Development No. VTP-NOID-0002-22 (Skylark Ranch, Santa Cruz County)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on notice of impending development submitted by the Santa Cruz County Resource Conservation District (pursuant to the Santa Cruz County Forest Health and Fire Prevention Public Works Plan) to apply ecological forest restoration treatments to 40 acres and to create 20 acres of shaded fuel breaks along Old Woman's Creek Road (and associated access roads) through manual and mechanical means, including related to invasive species control and ongoing maintenance, within the Girl Scouts of Northern California Camp Skylark Ranch in northern Santa Cruz County. (DN-SF)

subitem_title: Notice of Impending Development No. VTP-NOID-0003-22 (Last Chance Road, Santa Cruz County)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on notice of impending development submitted by the Santa Cruz County Resource Conservation District (pursuant to the Santa Cruz County Forest Health and Fire Prevention Public Works Plan) to apply ecological forest restoration treatments to 33 acres and to create 27 acres of shaded fuel breaks along Last Chance Road through manual and mechanical means, including invasive species control and ongoing maintenance, along Last Chance Road in northern Santa Cruz County. (DN-SF)

subitem_title: Appeal A-3-PSB-22-0005 (Beach House Vacation Rental, Pismo Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Commissioners Escalante and Hart from City of Pismo Beach coastal permit decision for after-the-fact authorization of 195 sq.ft. bedroom addition, 265 sq.ft. deck addition, and right-of-way improvements; and proposed new 490 sq.ft. raised parking deck and ramp, all at existing single-family home in back beach dunes of Pismo State Beach and adjacent to Pismo Creek at 136 Addie Street, Pismo Beach, San Luis Obispo County. (KB-SC) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Application No. 1-20-0560 (County of Humboldt Department of Public Works, Humboldt Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of County of Humboldt to construct, as part of California Coastal Trail (CCT), 4.25 miles of Class 1 multi-use trail along existing railroad on northeastern side of Humboldt Bay with three bridges, two viewing platforms, interpretive signs, fencing, drainage improvements, removal of approx. 200 Eucalyptus trees, and repair of eroding segments of railroad berm between Humboldt Bay Trail North CCT at Brainard Slough, Arcata and Eureka Waterfront Trail CCT at Y Street, Eureka, with separately permitted offsite wetland mitigation proposed at Tuluwat Island, Eureka and 70-acre agricultural property between V Street and Pacheco Lane west of Arcata (CH-A)

Coastal Commission consideration of Water Quality Strategy and Climate Action Plan developed by National Park Service (NPS) as specified in Conditions I and IV of the Coastal Commission’s conditional concurrence on Consistency Determination No. CD-0006-20 for the 2020 General Management Plan Amendment for Point Reyes National Seashore and the north district of Golden Gate National Recreation Area, Marin County. (CT-SF)

subitem_blurb: Application of Christian Fanticola to remove 642 sq.ft. floating dock, 3’ x 20’ gangway, and replace three steel pipe piles to support new 648 sq.ft. floating dock and 3’ x 24’ gangway, at 80 Linda Isle, Newport Beach, Orange County. (MR-LB)

Application of Benny Godoy to re-deck and reconfigure 19’x 8’ dock float to 17’x 8’ dock float, and replace two (2) 12” square concrete marina piles and two (2) 12” square concrete pier anchor piles with two (2) 12” square concrete marina piles and one 14” T-pile supporting the pier.  Proposed project also includes re-decking of the existing pier and gangway, but no other work is proposed to these two components, at 505 36th Street, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

Application of Jeff Kindness to remove 726 sq.ft. floating dock and 3’x18’ gangway and install 816 sq.ft. floating dock and 3’x18’ gangway.  Four (4) 16” square piles will remain and be re-used, at 3552 Gilbert Drive, Huntington Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

Application of Richard L. Rosen to repair existing bulkhead by adding new, 4’, 2” stem wall atop bulkhead coping, and install two, new tiebacks inserted into existing bulkhead coping and extending to new, landward deadman, at 3906 River Ave., Newport Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
